description: A group of inflammatory conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, primarily including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
A cytokine involved in the regulation of immune responses, particularly in the context of inflammatory diseases.
An anti-inflammatory cytokine that plays a crucial role in regulating immune responses.
A pro-inflammatory cytokine that is part of the interleukin-1 family, involved in various immune responses.
A pro-inflammatory cytokine that is part of the interleukin-1 family, playing a key role in inflammation.
A class of medications used to reduce inflammation by targeting tumor necrosis factor, commonly used in inflammatory conditions.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation of the digestive tract, leading to various gastrointestinal symptoms.
